channel.title: BUpolitics
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUpolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Report Says Illegal Aliens Responsible for Up to 75% of Violent Crime Arrests in Midtown Manhattan
item.description: New York City is in the midst of a violent migrant crime wave. According to a recent report by the New York Post, illegal aliens account for up to 75 ...

item.title: Trump's Wall Street pitch: Punishing tariffs, low taxes, 'explosive' growth
item.description: Trump arrived in New York amid growing concerns among some investors about his economic plans as Harris casts his agenda as a financially calamitous w...

item.title: Musk Role in a Trump Presidency Raises Conflict-of-Interest Questions
item.description: Leading a government efficiency commission would give Musk influence over the federal agencies that regulate his empire, including SpaceX and Tesla.

item.title: RFK Jr. made big promises to victims of pollution. Not all were kept.
item.description: Robert F. Kennedy made his reputation as an environmental lawyer and activist, but some involved in his most prominent cases say he failed them.

item.title: Trump says he would name Elon Musk head of government efficiency commission
Testosterone Clinics Sell Virility. Some Men End Up With Infertility.
item.description: Promoters in the booming steroid business tout a boost in the gym and the bedroom, but few talk about the possible side effects.

item.title: Is Sweden Turning the Corner on Open Borders?

item.title: Harris targets small business tax break in contrast with Trump’s corporate tax cuts
item.description: The vice president looks to beef up her economic plans ahead of next week's debate.

item.title: Nvidia and Other Investors Back Applied Digital With $160 Million in Funding
item.description: The fresh capital is expected to help the data-center and AI cloud-computing company grow.

item.title: How Republicans and Democrats paint starkly different pictures of America
item.description: This summer's conventions featured strongly diverging visions of the future — and the present.

item.title: OpenAI Co-Founder Ilya Sutskever's New AI Firm Raises $1 Billion
item.description: OpenAI co-founder Ilya Sutskever’s new firm, aimed at building “safe” artificial intelligence models, has raised $1 billion from investors.

item.title: Former vice president Dick Cheney says he will vote for Kamala Harris
item.description: Dick Cheney served as George W. Bush’s No. 2 and epitomized the Republican Party for decades.

item.title: Vance warns of China’s influence during Michigan rally
item.description: Vance’s rally Tuesday was the first of a series of events in Rust Belt swing states that he and Trump are visiting this week.

item.title: North Korean Spies Are Infiltrating U.S. Companies Through IT Jobs
item.description: Companies are unknowingly hiring North Koreans for hundreds of low-level jobs, giving isolated Pyongyang access to cash and intellectual property.

item.title: Analysis: Trump’s sudden move to re-litigate sexual abuse claims goes off the rails
